metadata.case_name: New Manek Chowk Spinning and Weaving Mills Ltd. & Ors. v. Municipal Corporation of the City of Ahmedabad & Ors.

facts.text: Group of Writ Petitions under Art. 32 challenging validity of assessment book relating to special Property section prepared by Municipal Corporation of Ahmedabad imposing property tax on textile mills, factories, university buildings etc. on flat rate per 100 sq. ft. of floor area.
In W.P. Nos. 133, 156-157, 159-171, 178, 184, 234/1966, challenge to 1966-67 assessment book after authentication post disposal of complaints.
In W.P. Nos. 206, 210/1966, challenge to 1964-65, 1965-66 assessments after authentication and attachments levied.
In W.P. No. 234/1966 filed October 1966, challenge to distress warrant and attachment.
Several textile mills in Ahmedabad have common complaint against assessments.

Bombay Provincial Municipal Corporations Act 1949 (LIX of 1949) relevant provisions: S.127 obliges property tax; S.128 recovery methods; S.129 property taxes on buildings/lands; definitions in S.2(5),2(30),2(49),2(53),2(54); S.453 rules part of Act; Taxation Rules Ch.VIII esp. R.7,9,10,13,15-21.

W.P. 133/1966 by New Manek Chowk Spinning and Weaving Mills Ltd. vs. Municipal Corp., Deputy Mun. Commr., State of Gujarat; challenge to 1966-67 assessment book using flat rate Rs.6-10-0/100 sq.ft. processing, Rs.5-4-0 non-processing; additional land on market rate; machinery on effective value.

Petitioners complain flat rate ignores locality, quality, age, nature; arbitrary, violates Art.14; discriminates vs. other buildings; tax on plant/machinery beyond competence; R.7(3) arbitrary; no ward books prepared; adoption from prior year invalid; authentication by Deputy not Commissioner.

Counter affidavit: Tax on hypothetical rent including plant/machinery; R.7(2) considers factors; entries provisional subject to objections/appeals S.406,410,411; floor area accepted method; no need for ward books; delegation under S.49(1) valid.
Prior Gujarat HC writs (e.g. SCA 1365/1965) dismissed for insufficient Art.14 pleadings.

Example: Ahmedabad Laxmi Cotton Mills (WP 207/1966): Objections overruled Sep 15,1965; bill Sep17; appeal Sep27; demand Oct7; writ Oct16 dismissed May5,1966; attachment May7; second writ dismissed Jul18,1966.

legal_issues.text: Whether flat rate per sq.ft. floor area for rateable value of textile mills etc. violates Act/Rules and Art.14.
Whether R.7(2),(3) ultra vires as beyond List II Entry 49 (taxes on land/buildings), excessive delegation, violates Art.14.
Whether delegation to Deputy Commissioner under S.49(1) valid for quasi-judicial functions.
Whether no preparation of ward assessment books and adoption from prior years invalid.
Whether appeals illusory for Art.14 challenge.

petitioner_arguments.text: Flat rate method against Act/R.7 (rack rent basis), violates rating principles, arbitrary/discriminatory (different localities, ages, constructions), violates Art.14.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Bombay Provincial Mun. Corps. Act 1949 Ss.127-129, R.7,9; Art.14; Lokmanya Mills v. Barsi Mun. (1962 1 SCR 306)

petitioner_arguments.text: Tax on plant/machinery beyond List II Entry 49; R.7(2),(3) ultra vires competence/excessive delegation/no principles/Art.14.
Delegation to Deputy invalid (quasi-judicial); no ward books; prior authentications invalid.

respondent_arguments.text: Rateable value on hypothetical rent including plant/machinery as factory; floor area accepted rating method; entries provisional/objections/appeals available S.406+; no ward books needed; delegation valid.
Tenant lets factory as equipped unit, ignores age/location.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Faraday on Rating (floor area for similar factories)

court_reasoning.text: Flat rate not recognised method; ignores locality/age/construction; no evidence of similar conditions/contractors basis; leads to inequalities/no rational classification; municipality failed initial duty R.9(b); appeals illusory for Art.14.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Lokmanya Mills applies; method arbitrary, violates Art.14.

court_reasoning.text: R.7(2) beyond competence (List II Entry 49 taxes on land/buildings not machinery); no principles for specification; R.7(3) excessive delegation.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Legislative practice excludes machinery; hypothetical tenant considers but tax power limited.

court_reasoning.text: No need to decide delegation S.49(1).
court_reasoning.key_observation: Not necessary in view of above.

court_reasoning.text: Prior Gujarat HC not res judicata (no Art.14 pleadings); appeals require pre-payment, ineffective.

holdings.text: Flat rate method for 1964-67 assessment books invalid; violates Act/R.9(b), Art.14.
R.7(2),(3) ultra vires (beyond competence, excessive delegation).

precedents_cited.case_name: Lokmanya Mills v. Barsi Borough Municipality
precedents_cited.relevance: Flat rate per sq.ft. for mills invalid; must use recognised valuation methods.
Floorage basis arbitrary, lacks rational classification.

precedents_cited.case_name: Kunhali Haji v. State of Kerala
precedents_cited.relevance: Floor area tax lacks classification, invalid.
Appeals under S.406 do not cover vires/Art.14.

precedents_cited.case_name: Diamond Sugar Mills Ltd. v. State of U.P.
precedents_cited.relevance: Interpret legislative entries liberally but not beyond reasonable connotation.

precedents_cited.case_name: In re Central Provinces and Berar Act No. XIV of 1939
Ralla Ram v. Province of East Punjab

precedents_cited.relevance: English rating includes machinery but Indian lists exclude.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Flat rate discriminatory; violates equality, property rights.

statutes_cited.name: Bombay Provincial Municipal Corporations Act, 1949 (LIX of 1949)
statutes_cited.relevance: Property tax on rateable value (rack rent); rules integral; delegation; appeals.

statutes_cited.name: Taxation Rules under Bombay Provincial Municipal Corporations Act, 1949
statutes_cited.relevance: Rateable value computation; assessment book preparation/authentication; objections; recovery; R.7(2),(3) invalid.

statutes_cited.name: Seventh Schedule, List II
statutes_cited.relevance: Taxes on land and buildings; excludes plant/machinery.

outcome.summary: Petitions allowed; writ of mandamus directing Municipality to treat relevant entries in 1964-65, 1965-66, 1966-67 assessment books (special property section) as invalid/cancelled and prepare fresh assessment lists for textile mills etc.; costs to petitioners.
outcome.relief_granted: Mandamus to invalidate entries and prepare fresh lists; costs.

key_quotes.text: "The municipality did not observe the law and failed in its duty to determine the rateable value of each building and land... in terms of r. 9 b of the rules."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "Rule 7 2 of the rules framed under the Bombay Act of 1949 was beyond the legislative competence of the State."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "By prescribing valuation computed on the area of the factory building, the Municipality not only fixed arbitrarily the annual letting value... but rendered the statutory right... illusory."
key_quotes.speaker: court
